intro: Landolphia cordata, commonly known as the African arrowroot or black-eyed Susan, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Asclepiadaceae and is characterized by its striking yellow flowers with dark centers. The plant produces large, fleshy fruits that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas. Landolphia cordata is also valued for its ornamental appeal and has traditional uses in some cultures.
